techmeme.title: Filing: OpenAI says Musk's $97.4B bid contradicts his claims, made in the lawsuit against OpenAI, that its assets can't be "transferred away" for "private gain" (Malathi Nayak/Bloomberg)
OpenAI plans to offer free ChatGPT users unlimited access to GPT-5 at the "standard intelligence" level, with access to higher levels for Plus and Pro users (Igor Bonifacic/Engadget)
Google plans to begin testing an ML-based model in the US this year to estimate whether a user is under 18 to help provide more "age-appropriate experiences" (Emma Roth/The Verge)
AppLovin reports Q4 revenue up 44% YoY to $1.37B, vs. $1.26B est., net income up 248%, ad revenue up 73%, and Q1 guidance above est.; APP jumps 27%+ after hours (CJ Haddad/CNBC)
Sources: X has agreed to pay ~$10M to settle Trump's 2021 lawsuit against Twitter and then-CEO Jack Dorsey over the ban on his accounts after the January 6 riot (Wall Street Journal)
